odoo.data:
Hospital Administration Test general one_page
60 scoring_without_answers 80.0 open
1. The process of quickly obtaining an out-of-stock medication in an urgent situation is called _________. simple_choice
A. Code cart
0.0
B. Final fllter
0.0
C. Bulk compounding log
0.0
D. Emergency drug procurement
3.33
2. What is the area designed for the preparation of sterile products called? simple_choice
A. Formulary
0.0
B. In-patient pharmacy
0.0
C. Clean room
3.33
3. Voluntary or involuntary removal of a drug product by the manufacturer, usually pertaining to a particular shipment or lot number is called _______. simple_choice
A. Code cart
0.0
B. IVPB
0.0
C. Recall
3.33
4. A pharmacy located in a hospital that services only those patients in the hospital and its axillary area is called ___________. simple_choice
A. Satellite pharmacy
0.0
B. Out- patient pharmacy
3.33
C. In-patient pharmacy
0.0
5. The main in-patient pharmacy in a hospital that has pharmacy satellites. simple_choice
A. Community hospital
0.0
B. Central pharmacy
3.33
C. Community central pharmacy
0.0
6. Advance preparation of large quantities of unit-dose oral solutions/suspensions or small volume parentals for future use is called __________. simple_choice
.
A. Formulating
0.0
B. Batching
3.33
C. Bulk compounding log
0.0
7. Medications which must be prepared by following a specific recipe or formula, usually because they are not available commercially are called ______________. simple_choice
A. Compounds
0.0
B. Private compounds
0.0
C. Extemporaneous compounds
3.33
8. The type of formulary that requires physicians to order only the medications on the formulary list is known as ____________. simple_choice
A. Open formulary
0.0
B. Closed formulary
3.33
C. Formulary
0.0
9. A computerized patient medical record; also known as an electronic health record (EHR) is __________. simple_choice
A. EMR
0.0
B. Electronic medical record
0.0
C. All of the above
3.33
10. A sterile , preservative-free medication administered into a patient's epidural space (located near the spinal cord and backbone) is known as _______. simple_choice
A. Hormones
0.0
B. Epidural
3.33
C. Streoids
0.0
11. A form that tracks the medications administered to a patient is called __________. simple_choice
A. Patients wrist band
0.0
B. Medication administration record
3.33
C. Formulary
0.0
12. Medications having limited availability due to cost, manufacturing problems, or safety concerns are called _____________. simple_choice
A. Standing order
0.0
B. Reconstitute
0.0
C. Restricted distribution
3.33
13. The branch of in-patient pharmacy responsible for preparing, dispensing, and monitoring medications for specific patient areas is called ____________. simple_choice
A. Out-patient pharmacy
0.0
B. Pharmacy satellit
3.33
C. Central pharmacy
0.0
14. A hospital pharmacy that services patients who have left the hospital or who are visiting doctors in a hospital outpatient clinic is known as __________. simple_choice
A. Center pharmacy
0.0
B. Outpatient pharmacy
3.33
C. Pharmacy satellite
0.0
15. Medication that will expire soon after preparation within 1-6hr after preparation is called _________. simple_choice
A. Short stability
3.33
B. Standing order
0.0
C. Par
0.0
16. What color code is used for a person suffering from cardiac arrest? simple_choice
A. Red
0.0
B. Blue
3.33
C. Black
0.0
D. Green
0.0
17. What is AMC? simple_choice
A. Annual Machine Calibration
0.0
B. Annual Maintenance Contract
3.33
C. Atomic Mass Calibration
0.0
D. Autonomous Machine Calibration
0.0
18. A person is allowed to disallow a surgery. simple_choice
A. True
3.33
B. False
0.0
19. What is the thickness of the lead jacket that is maintained for XRay procedures? simple_choice
A. 0.25 mm
3.33
B. 2.5 mm
0.0
C. 25 mm
0.0
D. 250 mm
0.0
20. Who is the authority on laying the guidelines for Radioactive exposure? simple_choice
A. Defense Research And Development Organization
0.0
B. Bhabha Atomic Research Center
0.0
C. Atomic Energy Regulation Board
3.33
D. Indian Space Research Organization
0.0
21. What form must be filled before starting a surgery? simple_choice
A. SF 520
0.0
B. SF 521
0.0
C. SF 522
3.33
D. SF 523
0.0
22. What are the ISO standards for hospital equipment? simple_choice
A. 9001 – product design, development, installation and servicing, 9002 – quality assurance at production and installation charges, 9003 – testing and inspections
3.33
B. 9001 – sterility in hospitals, 9002 – regulations to follow before surgery, 9003 – post operative regulations
0.0
C. 9001 – designing of hospitals, 9002 – maintenance of hospitals, 9003 – hospital procedures
0.0
D. 9001 – setting up of hospital labs, 9002 – maintenance of sterility in labs, 9003 – maintenance of hospital equipment
0.0
23. In what cases can the medical data of the patient be disclosed? simple_choice
A. In case of emergency
0.0
B. In case of legal issues
3.33
C. In case of celebrity deaths
0.0
D. In case of study purposes
0.0
24. A good health triad does not include: simple_choice
A. Physical Status
0.0
B. Social Status
0.0
C. Mental Staus
0.0
D. Economic Staus
3.33
25. Determinants of Health does not include: simple_choice
A. Host
0.0
B. Agent
3.33
C. Risk Factors
0.0
D. Environment
0.0
26. Epidemiological triad does not include: simple_choice
A. Host
0.0
B. Agent
0.0
C. Risk factors
3.33
D. Environment
0.0
27. According to Gordon’s classification of prevention of disease includes all except one: simple_choice
A. Primary prevention
3.33
B. Universal prevention
0.0
C. Selective prevention
0.0
D. Indicated prevention
0.0
28. Prevent complications is included in which level of prevention ? simple_choice
A. Primary
0.0
B. Primordial
0.0
C. Secondary
3.33
D. Tertiary
0.0
29. Cross sectional study is included in which type of epidemiology study? simple_choice
A. Analytical
3.33
B. Descriptive
0.0
C. Randomised control
0.0
D. Nurse Cap
0.0
30. Which is not the step involved in preparedness of an epidemic : simple_choice
A. Manpower training
0.0
B. LogisticsLogistics
0.0
C. Rehabilitation
3.43
D. Diagnosis and Treatment
